newsitem.title: JAPAN: Fujitsu aims to sell 2.6 mln PCs in Japan in 97/98.
newsitem.headline: Fujitsu aims to sell 2.6 mln PCs in Japan in 97/98.

text.p: Fujitsu Ltd said on Tuesday that it plans to sell 2.6 million personal computers (PCs) in Japan in 1997/98, up 36 percent from the total expected for 1996/97.
The company plans to sell 1.2 million PCs overseas, up 50 percent from the sales target in the year ended on March 31, a company spokesman said.
The company expects that robust demand for notebook PCs will lead to growth in both domestic and overseas PC markets, the spokesman said.
Fujitsu launched PCs for individual use as opposed to corporate use in 1994. The company's business in individual PCs has turned profitable for the first time in 1996/97, the spokesman said.
